channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The speedbumps at the corner of aldenham street, 24th September
item.description:
The white arrows on the speedbump have been spray painted with red crosses. This has defaced the speedbump and made the road markings less clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Werrington Street, Somers Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet again another stench coming from the drains, 24th September
item.description:
Outside my house yet again from the drains is an awful smell, this affects me and my family greatly as it’s strong outside our door. Before you say it’s Thames water problem it is NOT. They have been and said it’s not the sewage line and that it’s the council responsibility. I have been passed back and forward between you and Thames water it’s becoming and a joke. I pay my council tax for stuff like this. Please get someone to have a look.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Normandy Way, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 52, 24th September
item.description:
The pavement is cracking / cracked due to the tree roots. Reported before and has been present for months now. Dangerous to the elderly using walking sticks and those who are vulnerable to falls. I have seen two people twist their ankle on the pavement. It has also cracked number 52s stone porch , and the crack is becoming worse causing property damage

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Esmond Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unfinished works outside 52 Murray Avenue, 24th September
item.description:
This work seems unfinished and has been left in this state for several weeks now. It blocks two parking spaces. Parking cones have been left there with no indication of when this will be sorted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, London

item.title: A resident has allowed her dog to s*** everywhere over public pavement, diarrhea and has not been cleared up properly. Hackney Council clean up team required, small children and family lived around here, have to walk past faeces everywhere on the way to & from school., 24th September
item.description:
